page.title: 05CULWORTH CHURCH
page.content: Culworth church is the oldest building in the village, parts of it dating from the thirteenth century. It is dedicated to St Mary and is in the Diocese of Peterborough. It is built of ironstone and grey limestone,considerable restoration has taken place.The old oak pews are sound as is the Jacobean pulpit. Monuments include one of marble dedicated to the D'Anvers family erected in 1790.There is also a headstone commemorating Charles Bacchus,an African brought to the village as a servant who died at 16 in 1762.There are five bells in the belfry they are still rung by a team of ringers.The heaviest weighs just over half a ton.The rector for 21yrs Canon S Brown retired in 1985 and left to live in the Cathedral Precinct,Peterborough.
